words.definition: a child who behaves very badly : an annoying child
words.verbalIllustration: a bunch of ill-mannered little brats

words.definition: feeling or displaying no fear by temperament
words.verbalIllustration: undaunted despite their repeated failures at starting a business
I was cross with her for being so careless

words.definition: to look through (as a place) carefully or thoroughly in an effort to find or discover something
words.verbalIllustration: the owner of the bed-and-breakfast often trolls antique stores for furniture and knickknacks
everyone scurried back to work as soon as they had finished their lunch in the cafeteria
if you continue to dawdle, we'll be late for sure
I was sure we wouldn't get there in time, but she told me not to fret.

words.definition: to cover something with an outer layer that becomes hard as it dries
words.verbalIllustration: The mud had caked on his boots.

words.definition: to put up with something painful or difficult
words.verbalIllustration: I will not brook insults from my own employees

words.definition: to remain in place in readiness or expectation of something
words.verbalIllustration: I promise you that if you bide yet a little longer, all will come to pass just as you desire

words.definition: to remain in place in readiness or expectation of something
words.verbalIllustration: decided to bide her time until she had an opportunity to switch jobs

words.definition: to move or behave in a nervous and excited way
words.verbalIllustration: She nervously fluttered around the office

words.definition: to look at (someone or something) especially in order to get information
words.verbalIllustration: He wants to scope out all of the possibilities before deciding what to do

words.definition: an area over which activity, capacity, or influence extends
words.verbalIllustration: the company's scope of operations now spans two continents
I know we can take that team
the area teems with entrepreneurs hoping to hit upon the next big thing

words.definition: :having or showing no understanding of what is proper or acceptable  :rude or insensitive
words.verbalIllustration: A few people seemed shocked by her crass comments.

words.definition: :to direct the business or activities of (something)
:to do (a test or check) on someone or something
words.verbalIllustration: The doctors need to run some more tests.
